title: Influence of Drug-Polymer Interactions on Release Kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PET Nanoparticles
summary: The poster discusses the influence of drug-polymer interactions on release kinetics of poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and polylactide/ethylene glycol copolymers (PLA/PEG) nanoparticles in microfluidic systems, highlighting their potential to improve antimicrobial resistance by providing precise control over nanocarrier characteristics and encapsulation efficiency.
methods: The text does not contain any specific methodological details or experimental procedures related to the influence of drug-polymer interactions on release kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PEG nanoparticles. It appears to be an abstract or introduction section discussing antimicrobial resistance and microfluidic synthesis of nano-sized carriers for drug delivery systems.
results: The release kinetics of poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and polylactide-co-ethylene glycol copolymer nanoparticles (PLA/PEG-NPs) were studied in microfluidic devices to understand their influence on drug-polymer interactions. The study aimed to develop novel drug delivery systems that can improve encapsulation efficiency and provide precise control over nanocarrier characteristics.
